page.title: 10POLICE
page.content: Cimla is policed by "G" division of the South Wales Constabulary.A "police week" was arranged at Crynallt Junior school in June 1985.Class 4E learned about different aspects of police work. They saw a film about the dangers of going with strangers.A dog handler brought in a dog called Todd which was trained to attack criminals and to sniff out drugs,explosives and missing people. A constable from Traffic Division brought a motor-way police car which is sometimes called a "Jam sandwich"because it has a red stripe along each side.The equipment in the car included a computer,radio, telephone,blue laser lights and items used at the scene of an accident.The class also learned about road safety and the importance of using the Green Cross Code.Instruction was also given in Cycling Proficiency.
